headline: Welcome Thomas!
All the best with your new position in Dresden Jacky!
Welcome Yudai!
Our Majorana-Noise paper is out! And Michelle wrote a [nice item](https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/news/2023/06/new-method-to-find-majoranas-tested-for-the-first-time) about it.
The [SuperC website](https://superc2033.com) is live! We are excited to be part of this journey.
Jiasen's paper on noise in mesoscopic junctions is [on arXiv](https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.02397).
How does superconductivity break down with high doping? Our new [paper in Nature Materials](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41563-023-01497-1) shines some light on the issue.
Willem defends his PhD. Contratulations!

Two new papers on arXiv! One on [persistent gaps and non-mean-field breakdown of SC](https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.09740), and one on [shot-noise of individual (putative) Majorana modes](https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.10346).
Milan wins an ERC CoG grant! See [Leiden news](https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/news/2022/03/understanding-superconductivity-comes-closer-with-major-erc-grant-for-milan-allan).

**Our new paper, on Cooper pairs above Tc, is published in [Science](https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.abe3987)**. See [SRON news](https://www.sron.nl/news/5169-elektronparen-blijven-stabiel-boven-kritische-temperatuur-supergeleiding), [TU Delft news](https://www.tudelft.nl/en/2021/eemcs/inexplicably-stable-electron-pairs-without-superconductivity), [Leiden news](https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/news/2021/10/new-quantum-liquid-discovered), [Physics World](https://physicsworld.com/a/cooper-pairs-spotted-above-critical-temperature-for-superconductivity/).
Maialen will join us within a collaboration with the Swart Lab -- welcome Maialen!
Amber will join us with Casimir-Nanofront PhD fellowship -- welcome Amber!
Welcome Jinwon!
Koen wrote about his research in EurophysicsNews (page 12).
Our new paper on twisted bilayer graphene from our Leiden-ICFO collaboration in PRR.
Koen wins the Ehrenfest-Afanassjewa prize for best physics thesis of the Netherlands!
New paper on arXiv, on Cooper pairs above Tc
Our YSR paper is out, in collaboration with Copenhagen.
Our new paper is out, in collaboration with the groups of Baumberger, Perry and Mackenzie.
Maarten's paper is published in Microsyst Nanoeng.
Welcome Jiasen!
TGB paper (led by ICFO and Geneva) is in Nature Physics! See also coverage by Dorine Schenk in NRC
Maarten's paper is published in PRB.
LION made a nice video about Koen and his research.
Irene wins discoverer of the year by the faculty of Science! (Press release)!
Koen defends his PhD with a cum laude (top 5%)!
The noise doubling paper is published in Phys. Rev. B!
Doohee got an assistant professor job at Yonsei University!
The inhomogeneous superfluid paper is published in Nature!
We imaged the doubling of shot noise due to Andreev reflections in a STM, posted on arXiv.
The smart tip paper is finally published ! A collaboration with the Gr√∂blacher Lab at TU Delft.
Irene defends her PhD!
Dome makes it on the University website.
Our paper about how to construct an STM is in Review of Scientific Instruments.
We discovered charge trapping in a high-Tc superconductor! Publication in Nature Physics.
Our MHz amplifier for STM is published in Review of Scientific Instruments.
Milan, Koen and Irene talk about superconductivity in Made in Leiden.
Welcome Ram!
Irene and Milan are at the March Meeting (Talk Tue 10am, session E45)
New paper published in collaboration with the group of Jan van Ruitenbeek
Doohee makes the third place at the LION Image Award.
We contributed to Miguel and Jan's new paper.
We got an ERC starting grant.
Our paper is published in SciPost Physics.
Milan wins the Bryan R. Coles prize at SCES 2017, Prague. Koen received the best poster presentation award.
Koen, Maarten and Milan will be at SCES 2017, Prague. Come check out our posters on Tuesday&Thursday and talk on Thursday!
Paper on poor electronic screening published in PRB as Editors' selection!
